filters.description: Stable non-beta releases only (draft=false, prerelease=false, no 'beta' in tag/name)

latestStableNonBeta.body:
## New Features
- Added `WS_PROXY`/`WSS_PROXY` environment support (including lowercase variants) for websocket proxying in the network proxy. (#11784)
- App-server v2 now emits notifications when threads are archived or unarchived, enabling clients to react without polling. (#12030)
- Protocol/core now carry distinct approval IDs for command approvals to support multiple approvals within a single shell command execution flow. (#12051)

## Bug Fixes
- `Ctrl+C`/`Ctrl+D` now cleanly exits the cwd-change prompt during resume/fork flows instead of implicitly selecting an option. (#12040)
- Reduced false-positive safety-check downgrade behavior by relying on the response header model (and websocket top-level events) rather than the response body model slug. (#12061)

## Documentation
- Updated docs and schemas to cover websocket proxy configuration, new thread archive/unarchive notifications, and the command approval ID plumbing. (#11784, #12030, #12051)

## Chores
- Made the Rust release workflow resilient to `npm publish` attempts for an already-published version. (#12044)
- Standardized remote compaction test mocking and refreshed related snapshots to align with the default production-shaped behavior. (#12050)

## Changelog

Full Changelog: https://github.com/openai/codex/compare/rust-v0.103.0...rust-v0.104.0

- #11784 feat(network-proxy): add websocket proxy env support @viyatb-oai
- #12044 don't fail if an npm publish attempt is for an existing version. @iceweasel-oai
- #12040 tui: exit session on Ctrl+C in cwd change prompt @charley-oai
- #12030 app-server: Emit thread archive/unarchive notifications @euroelessar
- #12061 Chore: remove response model check and rely on header model for downgrade @shijie-oai
- #12051 feat(core): plumb distinct approval ids for command approvals @owenlin0
- #12050 Unify remote compaction snapshot mocks around default endpoint behavior @charley-oai

parityStatusDefinitions.not-applicable: Codex CLI/runtime feature outside plugin scope
parityStatusDefinitions.runtime-blocked: Would require runtime tool surface support to implement fully

bucketSummaries.label: Models / Capabilities
bucketSummaries.rationale: Dynamic model capability sync + reasoning auto-clamp are implemented in plugin.

examples.text: Makes it possible to configure custom HTTP headers when making requests to model providers: https://github.com/openai/codex/pull/1473.
Honor the `OPENAI_BASE_URL ` environment variable for the built-in `openai` model provider: https://github.com/openai/codex/pull/1487
As of https://github.com/openai/codex/pull/1594, we now stream the response from the model in the TUI and when using `codex exec`
`gpt-5` is the default model!
new `--ask-for-approval on-request` option where the model decides whether to prompt the user (which is somewhat of a balance between the existing `on-failure` and `never`) options

bucketSummaries.label: Tools / Schemas
bucketSummaries.rationale: Schema-safe tool-argument recovery and runtime tool capability registry are implemented; full runtime tool surface parity remains runtime-dependent.

examples.text: `id` for notifications associated with a `codex` tool call now match the request id: https://github.com/openai/codex/pull/1554

https://github.com/openai/codex/pull/1571 fixes a longstanding issue where we failed to handle long MCP tool names gracefully (https://github.com/openai/codex/issues/1289 was the relevant GitHub issue)
Numerous fixes to `codex mcp`.
https://github.com/openai/codex/pull/1726 introduces an experimental planning tool
https://github.com/openai/codex/pull/1975 add JSON schema sanitization for MCP tools to ensure compatibility with internal JsonSchema enum external contributor: Thanks @yaroslavyaroslav!

bucketSummaries.label: Approvals / Policy
bucketSummaries.rationale: Approval/policy failures are classified explicitly and no longer trigger account rotation.

examples.text: Adds support for a `--sandbox` flag and makes some breaking changes to `config.toml` around this option. See https://github.com/openai/codex/pull/1476 for details.
https://github.com/openai/codex/pull/1705 security fix to ensure `apply_patch` is run through the sandbox for the session
new onboarding flow that uses `--sandbox workspace-write and --ask-for-approval on-request` as the configuration when users mark a folder is trusted (recommended default when working in a Git repo)
Simplify command approval UI (#2708)
#2708 [feat] Simplfy command approval UI

bucketSummaries.label: Routing / Reroute / Retry
bucketSummaries.rationale: Reroute logging + UI notices and route-aware retry matrix exist, but matrix remains opt-in (`legacy` default).

examples.text: UI/UX polish: Ghostty Ctrl‑b/Ctrl‑f fallback (#2427), Ctrl+H as backspace (#2412), cursor position tweak after tab completion (#2442), color/accessibility updates (#2401, #2421).
[#2427](https://github.com/openai/codex/pull/2427) tui: support Ghostty Ctrl-b/Ctrl-f fallback
Cap retry counts (#2701)
#2701 Added caps on retry config settings
[#4096] Use TestCodex builder in stream retry tests (#4096)

bucketSummaries.label: Codex CLI / TUI
bucketSummaries.rationale: Codex CLI runtime behavior/UI internals are upstream concerns; plugin can only adapt via prompts/config and runtime signals.

examples.text: Fixes an issue where non-ASCII characters were crashing the CLI: https://github.com/openai/codex/issues/1450 (huge thanks to @ryozi-tn for the fix in https://github.com/openai/codex/pull/1467)

Add a `completion` subcommand to the CLI in https://github.com/openai/codex/pull/1491 so we can ultimately add `generate_completions_from_executable()` to our Homebrew formula: https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/blob/main/Formula/c/codex.rb
Thanks to @reneleonhardt for helping update a number of our dependencies (we now build with Rust 1.88!): https://github.com/openai/codex/pull/1494
Thanks to @pchuri so that when running Codex installed via `npm`, `process.platform === "android"` will run the Rust CLI: https://github.com/openai/codex/pull/1488
Fix generated shell completions to use the name `codex` instead of `codex-cli`: https://github.com/openai/codex/pull/1496

bucketSummaries.label: Auth / OAuth
bucketSummaries.rationale: Plugin maintains its own OAuth flow and token handling; some Codex auth changes are upstream CLI-specific.

examples.text: https://github.com/openai/codex/pull/2200 send prompt cache key for better caching (should improve token efficiency!)
Auth improvements: show login options when not signed in with ChatGPT (#2440) and auto‑refresh ChatGPT auth token (#2484).
[#2484](https://github.com/openai/codex/pull/2484) Refresh ChatGPT auth token
#2699 Fixed a bug that causes token refresh to not work in a seamless manner
#2688 Add auth to send_user_turn

bucketSummaries.label: Logging / Observability
bucketSummaries.rationale: Structured warnings/logging added for reroute, deprecation, and failure-route diagnostics.

examples.text: We now record some Git state in the `.jsonl` log due to @vishnu-oai https://github.com/openai/codex/pull/1598
[Logging/Telemetry]
feat: tighten preset filter, tame storage load logs, enable rollout prompt by default (#3628)
When logging in using ChatGPT, make sure to overwrite API key (#3611)
Log cf-ray header in client traces (#3488)

items.text: GPT-5.1-Codex-Max: introducing our newest frontier agentic coding model. GPT-5.1-Codex-Max delivers higher reliability, faster iteration, and support for long-running, project-scale workflows. Learn more at https://www.openai.com/index/gpt-5-1-codex-max

items.rationale: Dynamic model capability sync + reasoning auto-clamp are implemented in plugin.
items.text: Expanded Tool Token Limits: codex models now support up to 10,000 tool output tokens. Configure this via `tool_output_token_limit` in `config.toml`.

items.rationale: Approval/policy failures are classified explicitly and no longer trigger account rotation.
items.text: Windows Agent mode: Introduced Agent mode for native Windows. Codex can read files, write files, and run commands in your working folder with fewer approvals. Agent mode uses a new experimental Windows sandbox to limit filesystem and network access. Learn more at https://developers.openai.com/codex/windows

items.rationale: Codex CLI runtime behavior/UI internals are upstream concerns; plugin can only adapt via prompts/config and runtime signals.
items.text: Threads and turns now include git info, current working directory, CLI version, source metadata, and propagate thread and turn IDs on every item and error. They emit new notifications for diffs, plan updates, token-usage changes, and compaction events. File-change items provide output deltas, and ImageView items render images inline.

items.rationale: Release note item did not match current plugin-focused semantic buckets; manual review may still be needed.
items.text: Review flow is enhanced with a detached review mode, explicit enter and exit events, review thread IDs, and review history remains visible after rollout filtering changes.

items.rationale: Dynamic model capability sync + reasoning auto-clamp are implemented in plugin.
items.text: Execution gains an experimental “exp” model, unified exec pruning to limit session bloat, per-run custom environment injection, policy-approved command bypass, and Windows protections that flag risky browser or URL launches. History lookup now works on Windows and WSL, and model selection honors use_model.

items.rationale: Approval/policy failures are classified explicitly and no longer trigger account rotation.
items.text: Safety defaults improve via consolidated world-writable scanning and workspace-write enforcement of read-only .git directories. Sandbox assessment and approval flows align with trust policies.

items.rationale: Dynamic model capability sync + reasoning auto-clamp are implemented in plugin.
items.text: MCP and shell tooling add shell-tool MCP login support, explicit capability declaration, sandbox awareness, publication to npm, and MCP elicitations. The rmcp client is upgraded to 0.10.0 for modern notifications.

items.rationale: Plugin maintains its own OAuth flow and token handling; some Codex auth changes are upstream CLI-specific.
items.text: Observability increases as command items expose process IDs and threads and turns emit token-usage and compaction events. Feedback metadata captures source information.

items.text: Tooling and ops gain follow-up v2 in the app-server test client, new config management utilities, and refreshed approvals documentation and quickstart placement.

items.text: MCP startup tolerates missing type fields, stream error messages are clarified, and rmcp nix output hash issues are resolved.

items.text: Codex CLI subprocesses again inherit env vars like `LD_LIBRARY_PATH`/`DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH` to avoid runtime issues. As explained in #8945, failure to pass along these environment variables to subprocesses that expect them (notably GPU-related ones), was causing 10x+ performance regressions! Special thanks to @johnzfitch for the detailed investigation and write-up in #8945. (#8951)

items.rationale: Dynamic model capability sync + reasoning auto-clamp are implemented in plugin.
